column3: If morale drops, this is the percent chance that a unit will fallback (100 pts)
If morale drops, this is the percent chance that a unit will retreat (100 pts), ex. If all values add up to 40, that unit has a 40 percent chance of retreating each time morale lowers
Please remember that morale is already modified by the leader attributes, so keep this to experience level, fatigue, and morale
Put in negative numbers to make sure that it can never happen in certain situations
Initial design has 40pts-morale,30pts-exp,20pts-fatigue, max 90 pct chance of retreat
Commander Radius (% of hardcoded value)  HARDCODED:  0 yds - Bn// 0 yds - Regt //  50 yds - Brig //  100 yds - Div // 150 yds - Corps //  250 yds - Army and side
Units run or walk to ammo wagon  (summed up- 0 or greater they run)
Commanders run or walk to "Support" units     (summed up- 0 or greater they run)
Max ammo per/man from ammo wagon
Choose Objective Bonuses 1 = morale     2 = fatigue     4 = ammo     This should only be set in one row!
The modifier on the unit that lost a casualty
The modifier on another unit when they lose a casualty when you are close to them
Penalty at different levels of fatigue against running or charging ONLY, this is a percentage so -40 means -.4 to the factor
The distance that an arty unit will fire if set on conserver ammo mode, set by officer only
How close the enemy has to be before the arty starts packing up and/or retreating

column34: Ability: Affects the rallying times of "broken" units.   AFFECTED BY: Completing orders on time.
Command: Grade determines size/area of command radius .   AFFECTED BY: Combined battle grades of all subordinate units.
Control: Leader?s grade reduces # of deserters from player?s routed units.   AFFECTED BY: Total kill ratio of subordinate units.
Leadership: Amount of morale bonus given to leader?s units.   AFFECTED BY: Completing orders/mission goals.
Experience: Amount of combat experience and/or service time of a commander or unit
Close Order Proficiency: Increases speed of wheeling and formation changes.
Open Order Proficiency: Increases hit%, decreases misfires, decreases rate of fire, decreases hit% during melee.
Edged Weapon Proficiency: Increases hit % during melee and melee speed.  Translates to Bayonet, Sword, Saber, and Lance Drill.
Firearm Proficiency: Number is added to the base value in the misfire column (arsenal.csv file)--random # is selected & if same or higher then shot is MADE.
Marksmanship: Number is added to the base value (# in read row in arsenal.csv file)?.random # is selected & if same or higher?a hit is scored.
Horsemanship: Increases speed of wheeling and formation changes for cavalry and artillery.
Surgeon Ability: Increases the % of wounded troops returned to active duty after the battle.
